names.hanzi: cyperus, artemisia, ligusticum and angelica decoction
names.commonEnglish: Cyperus, Artemisia, Ligusticum and Angelica Decoction

actions: Spreads and regulates Liver Qi, regulates menstruation and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, tonifies the Blood and moves Qi, for premenstrual symptoms, menstrual pain and irregular menstruation.
With Dang Gui and Chuan Xiong, for irregular menstruation and dysmenorrhea due to Qi and Blood Stasis.
With Chuan Xiong, for Qi Stagnation combined with Blood Stasis.
Warms the channels, warms the womb, stops bleeding, calms the fetus, disperses Cold and alleviates pain.
With Xiang Fu, for abdominal pain from Deficiency Cold and Stagnant Qi.
Invigorates the Blood and promotes the movement of Qi.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency causing menstrual problems including dysmenorrhea, scanty menses, and amenorrhea.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, stops pain due to Blood Stasis and regulates the menses.
Invigorates the Blood, circulates Qi, stops pain and disperses extravasation.
With Xiang Fu, treats a wide range of applications from Liver Qi Stagnation to deep Blood Stasis and a wide variety of pain
With Xiang Fu and Dang Gui, for dysmenorrhea from Qi Stagnation and Blood Stasis.
With Chuan Xiong, for body aches and headaches due to Blood Stagnation.

syndromes: Retention of the lochia after childbirth due to Qi and Blood stagnation.

symptoms: No lochial discharge after childbirth or
Only slight lochial discharge after childbirth

modifications.purpose: scanty discharge with clots and pain
